perturbation.original_text: The Owner authorizes Curo Management, LLC, to act, and Curo Management, LLC, agrees to act, as an independent contractor, as the Servicer effective upon the date hereof. (b) From and after the date on which a Receivable or Participation Interest, as applicable, is sold to the Owner, the Servicer shall service and administer each related Serviced Asset for the benefit of the Owner and shall extend, amend or otherwise modify such Serviced Asset, by complying in all material respects with the following (collectively, the "Servicing Standard"): (A) reasonable care, using that degree of skill and attention that the Servicer exercises with respect to comparable receivables that it services for itself or others, and (B) Applicable Law.
perturbation.changed_text: The Owner authorizes Curo Management, LLC, to act, and Curo Management, LLC, agrees to act, as a contractor, as the Servicer effective upon the date hereof. (b) From and after the date on which a Receivable or Participation Interest, as applicable, is sold to the Owner, the Servicer shall manage each related Serviced Asset for the benefit of the Owner and may extend, amend or otherwise modify such Serviced Asset, by complying with the following (collectively, the "Servicing Guideline"): (A) ordinary care, using skill and attention that the Servicer deems appropriate, and (B) Relevant Law.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'independent contractor' is changed to 'contractor' and the language regarding responsibilities is modified, also, 'Servicing Standard' and 'Applicable Law' are changed to 'Servicing Guideline' and 'Relevant Law', adding ambiguity and weakening the Servicer's obligations by reducing their duty of care from "reasonable care" to "ordinary care" and the degree of skill required to what the Servicer 'deems appropriate'. 'Shall' is replaced with 'may', introducing further discretion.

perturbation.original_text: The Servicer will be entitled to receive the Servicing Fee for the performance of the duties and provision of the services called for in this Agreement in accordance with, and subject to, the Loan Agreement. The Servicing Fee shall be payable on each Payment Date for the immediately prior Servicing Period in accordance with Section 2.4 of the Loan Agreement. Any opinion, filing or other services performed by the Servicer hereunder that generates additional costs shall be at the expense of the Owner.
perturbation.changed_text: The Servicer will be entitled to receive the Servicing Compensation for the services detailed in this Agreement in accordance with the guidelines of the Loan Agreement. The Servicing Compensation will be paid on each Payment Date for the prior Servicing Period. Any opinion, filing or services performed by the Servicer hereunder that lead to additional costs will be considered for reimbursement by the Owner.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Servicing Fee' to 'Servicing Compensation' introduces ambiguity. Changing 'duties' to 'services' and 'called for in this Agreement' to 'detailed in this Agreement' introduces uncertainty. Also, 'shall be at the expense of the Owner' is changed to 'will be considered for reimbursement by the Owner,' making cost recovery discretionary and weakening the Servicer's position.

perturbation.changed_text: Any notice, report or other communication provided hereunder must be in writing, delivered by mail, courier, or electronic means and directed as follows: (a) if to the Owner, to: CURO Receivables Finance II, LLC c/o CURO Management LLC 3527 North Ridge Road Wichita, KS 67205 Attention: Don Gayhardt E-Mail: don.gayhardt@curo.com Cc: CURO Financial Technologies Corp. 3527 North Ridge Road Wichita, KS 67205 Attention: Vin Thomas E-Mail: vinthomas@curo.com Cc: the Servicer, at the address provided below. (b) if to the Servicer, to: CURO Management LLC 3527 North Ridge Road Wichita, KS 67205 Attention: Don Gayhardt E-Mail: don.gayhardt@curo.com Cc: CURO Financial Technologies Corp. 3527 North Ridge Road Wichita, KS 67205 Attention: Vin Thomas E-Mail: vinthomas@curo.com or to an alternative address any party communicates to the others. Any notice required hereunder is considered delivered if sent by certified mail, prepaid, physically delivered or sent via facsimile to the address of the intended recipient.
perturbation.explanation: By changing shall to must and deemed to is considered, the language becomes weaker. Also, overnight courier is removed, and electronic communication or facsimile is replaced with electronic means. With a copy to is changed to Cc, and the wording is slightly altered for alternative addresses to any party communicates to the others. Moreover, postage prepaid is removed from certified mail, introducing possible ambiguity regarding postage. These differences creates uncertainty about whether all notices have been correctly delivered, thereby complicating enforcement and potentially resulting in a disagreement on service.
